intro: Astripomoea lachnosperma, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and leaves that are often ribbed and have a waxy texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by specialized leaf-like structures called bracts. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, disturbed soils. Astripomoea lachnosperma is adapted to thrive in environments with high humidity and partial shade.
